Dear Katrina Dahl Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/03/23, youth was engaging in unsafe behaviors and made
a stabbing motion towards himself. Staff member grabbed youth
below the shoulders and wrapped his arm around the youth. Both
staff member and youth fell back. The restraint was improper.
Investigation This complaint was received on 11/06/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
I interviewed Complainant/Director onsite on 11/06/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported he
reviewed the video footage after speaking with staff regarding the
incident. He said Youth A got upset when staff changed the
afternoon activity from going to the park to going to the library.
Youth A became upset, assaulted staff and was put in a team
hold. Youth A continued to escalate, grabbed an object off staff’s
desk, attempted to stab staff, and that’s when Staff 1 used an
improper restraint.
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 11/06/2023, in collaboration with
MDDHS Specialist. Youth A reported he has only been at the
agency for one week. Youth A recalled being restrained by staff
and admitted he assaulted staff. He said staff put him in a
standing restraint and one staff put his elbow on his back and
leaned him forward. He further reported one staff slammed him on
the floor. He said he had a knot on his head afterwards.
I Interviewed Youth B onsite on 11/06/2023, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Youth B recalled the incident involving Youth
A. Youth B reported Youth A was upset and started fighting with
staff. He saw Youth A throw something at staff and Youth A tried
to stab staff. Youth B saw staff restrain Youth A and saw Youth A
hitting his head on the floor.
I interviewed Staff 1 on site on 11/07/2023, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a youth worker and has been
working at the agency for 5 years. He reported on 11/03/2023 they
changed the afternoon activity from going to the park to going to
the library due to the weather. When Youth A found out they were
not going to the park, he started to yell and pace back and forth.
He and Staff 2 attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth A, but he
became more aggressive and attempted to punch him twice. He
and Staff 2 put Youth A in a two-person standing restraint. Youth
A dropped down to his knees, so they dropped to their knees, and
released the restraint. Youth A again started to yell at Staff 1 and
2

said, “I am going to beat your old ass.” Youth A went behind the
staff’s desk, and threw a roll of towels, a stapler, and notebook.
Youth A then grabbed something and motioned like he was going
to stab him, so he went behind Youth A and wrapped his arms
around Youth A. He and Youth A tripped and they both fell to the
floor. Staff 1 said he is diabetic and at that point he started to feel
dizzy. He immediately stood, attempted to comfort Youth A,
because Youth A was mumbling, but not making sense. He
denied Youth A lost conscious or was foaming at the mouth. He
said Staff 2 called the supervisor and called EMS.
I interviewed Staff 2 onsite on 11/07/2023, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is Shift leader, has been working at the
agency for 2 months, and has completed all new hire training
including CPI. He reported on 11/03/2023 Youth Awas upset
because they changed the afternoon activities. Youth A was
pacing back and fort and yelling. He attempted to talk to Youth A
and calm him down, but he continued to escalate. Youth A
became more aggressive and attempted to punch Staff 1. Staff 2
said Youth A was put in a team hold for approximately one minute.
Youth was released when he dropped to his knees. Youth A
continued to be escalated and aggressive, he and Staff 1 tried to
verbally deescalate, but Youth A continued to target Staff 1. Staff
1 went behind Youth A, tried to restrain him, but they tripped, and
fell to the floor. Staff 2 immediately called the supervisor and was
instructed to contact 911.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker via telephone on
11/07/2023. She reported Youth A has been at the facility for one
week. She said Youth A is easily triggered and can be very
aggressive when upset.
On 11/20/2023 a predisposition conference was held with MDHHS
Specialist, MDHHS Supervisor, and Foster Care Worker. There is
no finding.
Video Reviewed:
• Video footage from 11/03/2023 at approximately 3:00 pm
was reviewed on 11/06/2023 (Note: there is no audio). The
video starts near the bathroom a partial view is seen of
Staff 1 and 2 holding Youth A in a two-person standing
restraint. Youth A drops down to his knees and staff
release the hold. Youth A stands up, goes behind the staff’s
desk, picks up an object, and throws it at Staff. Youth A
picks up another object and makes a stabbing motion at
Staff 1. Staff 1 goes behind Youth A, wraps his arms
3

around Youth A in a bear hug, Staff 1 and Youth A fall to
the floor. Staff 1 gets up immediately and is observed to
standing over Youth A. Staff 2 is seen talking on the phone.
Youth A is approximately several inches taller than Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 11/03/2023 completed by Staff 1.
Youth A was triggered when he was informed that activity
plan for the afternoon was changed. Youth A became
aggressive with staff. Staff attempted verbal de-escalation,
but Youth A became more aggressive and lunged at staff.
Youth A was placed in a team hold. Youth A again
continued to be assaultive, Staff 1 attempted to physical
manage Youth A, and staff and youth fell to the floor. Youth
A displayed seizure like symptoms and therefore EMS was
contacted.
• The agency CPI Physical Management Techniques: The
techniques used in the incident was, “The Child Control
Position technique”; gaining control of the child’s arms from
behind and crossing the arms in front of the child. The arms
should be positioned high on the child and secured by
locking one arm under the other. Position yourself behind
the child while maintaining close body contact and standing
to one side. This hold should be used with individuals
considerably smaller than staff.
• Staff 1 has one disciplinary action in his employee file
unrelated to this investigation. The disciplinary action dated
12/24/2022, was for allowing a youth to go on an
unapproved overnight home pass. CPI training log for Staff
1 was reviewed and he completed it on 03/23/2023.
Analysis The facility is in violation of the rule based on interviews with staff
and youth, video footage, and documentation. The staff used the
CPI child control hold, which is designed to be used with a youth
that is considerably smaller than a staff, but in this situation the
youth is approximately 3 inches taller than the staff.
Video footage reviewed determined staff didn’t slam Youth A on
the floor.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (2) Health status screening of the youth will occur immediately
after seclusion or restraint by staff assigned to this screening, as
defined in agency policy. If the youth has any physical complaints
or if the screening staff has any concerns, depending on the
severity of the complaint or concerns, the staff will arrange for the
youth’s health needs to be met immediately by any of the following
actions:
(c) Contacting emergency medical services.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth started experiencing symptoms of a pseudo seizure. Youth
was transported to the hospital where it was determined he did not
have a seizure but had high blood pressure.
Investigation Director reported staff attempted to put Youth A in a standing
restraint and they both fell to the floor. Youth A appeared to be
having a seizure, so staff immediate called 911. Youth A was
transported to the hospital, Youth A was examined, and it was
determined he did not have a seizure. Youth A’s blood pressure
was elevated but he did not require medical care.
Youth A reported he was taken to the hospital after being
restrained and staff slamming him on the floor.
Foster Care Worker reported she was notified of the incident and
informed that staff immediately contacted EMS after Youth A was
restrained. Youth A was transported to the hospital, examined,
and did not require any medical care. She said Youth A does not
have a seizure disorder but has a history of Pseudo Seizures
which is non epileptic attack that is triggered by stress.
Documents Reviewed:
• Medical assessment dated 11/03/2023. Youth A was
examined and there were no medical findings for seizures,
injuries, or bruises. Youth A was discharged with no
medical care required.
Analysis The facility is not in violation of the rule based on interviews and
documentation. On 11/03/2023 Youth A was restrained, fell to the
floor, appeared to be having a seizure, staff immediately called
911, and Youth A was transported to the hospital.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
